messages.message: so any reason REFINER_FNS shouldn’t _always_ be passed to refiner functions under the hood? we can hide it inside `**kwargs` for existing refiner functions so that we don’t have to change their definitions, but passing it from refiner makes functions unnecessarily long and with new list functions i’m working on (`filter`, `map`), you’d _always_ need to pass them in. interface would be much cleaner if we just snuck them in.
we should try to consolidate these FnContext i believe

FnContext is an object which is available in a variable inside of the kwargs. I’m OK with having an object which is passed to everybody; but we should centralize how that happens, and I think FnContext is a good place to do that
sounds good — will look at that + how we could incorporate it there likely next wk and get back to you with questions/comments.
